drills.name: B.E.E.F. Form Shooting
drills.description: Learn the perfect shooting form using Balance, Eyes, Elbow, Follow-through - the four keys to great shooting!
step_by_step: Stand close to the basket (3-5 feet away)
Get in BALANCE with feet shoulder-width apart
Keep your EYES focused on the back of the rim
Line up your shooting ELBOW under the ball
Shoot with soft FOLLOW-THROUGH, snapping your wrist down
Practice 10 shots, focusing on form not speed
Gradually move back as form improves
coaching_tips: Emphasize proper form over making shots initially
Use positive reinforcement for good form
Start very close to build confidence
Watch for common mistakes like side-arm shooting

drills.name: Around the World
drills.description: Travel around the world by making shots from different spots around the hoop!
step_by_step: Set up 7-10 shooting spots around the key in a semicircle
Start at the first spot (usually right baseline)
Make a shot to advance to the next spot
If you miss, you can either start over or stay at that spot
Continue around all spots to complete the 'world'
First player to complete all spots wins
coaching_tips: Adjust shooting distances based on age and ability
Allow younger kids to shoot from closer spots
Encourage proper shooting form at each spot
Make it fun with team challenges

drills.name: Layup Lines
drills.description: Practice running layups like the pros do in warm-ups!
step_by_step: Form two lines - one at right wing, one under the basket
Right wing line dribbles toward basket
Use proper footwork: right foot, left foot, then shoot
Aim for the top corner of the square on the backboard
Player under basket gets rebound and passes to next shooter
Switch lines after each attempt
Practice from both sides of the basket
coaching_tips: Teach proper footwork: outside foot, inside foot, then up
Start with walking speed, then increase to jogging
Emphasize using the backboard for younger players
Keep the line moving to maintain engagement

drills.name: HORSE
drills.description: Challenge your friends to match your creative shots in this classic game!
step_by_step: First player takes a shot from anywhere on the court
If they make it, next player must make the same shot
If second player misses, they get a letter (H, then O, then R, S, E)
If second player makes it, they become the shooter
Continue until someone spells H-O-R-S-E
Last player remaining wins
coaching_tips: Encourage creativity but keep shots realistic
Focus on form even during fun competitive games
Adjust rules for younger kids (use shorter words like 'PIG')
Keep everyone engaged by rotating quickly

drills.name: Knockout
drills.description: Fast-paced shooting game where you try to make your shot before the player behind you!
step_by_step: Form a line at the free throw line (or closer for younger players)
First two players get basketballs
Both players shoot at the same time
If first player makes their shot, they get the ball and go to back of line
If first player misses, they must get rebound and score before second player
If second player scores first, first player is 'knocked out'
Continue until only one player remains
coaching_tips: Start closer to basket for younger players
Keep game moving quickly to maintain excitement
Have multiple games going for larger groups

drills.name: Stationary Dribbling
drills.description: Master ball control by practicing dribbling in one spot using different techniques!
step_by_step: Start with basic dribbling with dominant hand
Keep ball low (below waist) and use fingertips
Practice 30 seconds with each hand
Add variations: high dribble, low dribble, crossover
Keep eyes up, not looking at the ball
Practice dribbling around your body
End with figure-8 dribbling through legs
coaching_tips: Start slow and build up speed gradually
Encourage keeping head up to see the court

drills.name: Dribble Tag
drills.description: Fun tag game where everyone must dribble while trying to avoid being tagged!
step_by_step: Every player has a basketball within court boundaries
Choose 1-2 players to be 'it' (depending on group size)
All players must dribble at all times
If tagged or lose control of ball, you become 'it'
If you dribble out of bounds, you become 'it'
Continue until time runs out
Switch who starts as 'it' for multiple rounds
coaching_tips: Adjust boundaries based on skill level
Encourage players to protect their dribble

drills.name: Cone Dribbling Course
drills.description: Navigate through a fun obstacle course while keeping control of your basketball!
step_by_step: Set up cones in a zigzag pattern down the court
Start at first cone with basketball
Dribble around each cone alternating hands
Use crossover dribble to change direction at each cone
Focus on keeping ball low and controlled
Time yourself and try to improve
Add variations like behind-the-back or between legs
coaching_tips: Start with wider spacing between cones
Make it competitive with relay races

drills.name: Red Light, Green Light
drills.description: Practice dribbling control by starting and stopping on command!
step_by_step: All players start at baseline with basketball
On 'Green Light', players dribble forward
On 'Red Light', players must stop immediately in triple threat position
On 'Yellow Light', players dribble in place
Add variations: 'Purple Light' (dribble backward)
First player to opposite end wins
Play multiple rounds with different commands
coaching_tips: Teach triple threat position during stops
Focus on ball control during direction changes

drills.name: Two-Ball Dribbling
drills.description: Challenge yourself by dribbling two basketballs at the same time!
step_by_step: Start with two basketballs, one in each hand
Begin dribbling both balls simultaneously
Practice alternating dribbles (right, left, right, left)
Try synchronous dribbling (both balls together)
Add movement: walk forward while dribbling
Practice crossovers with both balls
Challenge: dribble one high, one low
coaching_tips: This drill quickly reveals weaker hand
Be patient - this is very challenging

drills.name: Partner Passing
drills.description: Practice basic passing techniques with a partner to build accuracy and catching skills!
step_by_step: Stand 8-10 feet apart from partner
Start with chest passes - step forward and push through
Practice bounce passes - aim for spot 2/3 to partner
Try overhead passes - bring ball behind head
Focus on catching with both hands
Take one step back every 10 successful passes
Practice different pass types in sequence
coaching_tips: Teach proper hand position for different passes

drills.name: Monkey in the Middle
drills.description: Two players pass while one defender tries to steal the ball - great for passing under pressure!
step_by_step: Form groups of 3 players
Two players stand 12-15 feet apart
One player (the 'monkey') stands in the middle
Outside players pass back and forth
Middle player tries to deflect or steal passes
If middle player gets ball, they switch with passer
Focus on using fakes and quick passes
coaching_tips: Keep rotations active so everyone gets chances

drills.name: Circle Passing
drills.description: Practice passing and catching while moving in a circle with your team!
step_by_step: Form circle with 6-8 players
Start with one ball, pass to player across circle
After passing, jog to that player's spot
Continue passing and following your pass
Add second ball once rhythm is established
Change direction periodically
Add different types of passes
coaching_tips: Start slow and build up speed
Make it fun with different pass types

drills.name: Ultimate Basketball
drills.description: No dribbling allowed! Move the ball only by passing in this fun team game!
step_by_step: Divide into two teams of 4-5 players each
No dribbling allowed - only passing and pivoting
Score by passing ball to teammate in 'end zone'
Defense tries to intercept passes
If ball hits ground, possession changes
Players cannot run with ball - only pivot
Play to set number of points or time limit

drills.name: Four Corner Passing
drills.description: Practice passing and catching while moving to different corners of the court!
step_by_step: Set up four lines at corners of half court
Start with ball in one corner
Pass to adjacent corner (clockwise)
After passing, run to corner you passed to
Continue passing and following in sequence
Add second ball once rhythm established
Change direction and passing patterns
coaching_tips: Emphasize catching ball ready to pass

drills.name: Defensive Stance
drills.description: Learn the proper basketball defensive position - the foundation of good defense!
step_by_Step: Bend knees and stay low in athletic position
Keep back straight and chest up
Arms out to sides with palms up
Weight on balls of feet, ready to move
Practice staying in stance for 30 seconds
Move in stance: shuffle left, right, forward, back
coaching_tips: Don't let players cross feet when moving
Keep head up to see offensive player
Make it fun with mirror exercises

drills.name: Mirror Drill
drills.description: Practice defensive footwork by mirroring your partner's movements!
step_by_step: Partner up players facing each other
One player is offense, one is defense
Offensive player moves slowly side to side
Defensive player mirrors movements in defensive stance
No contact allowed - just footwork practice
Switch roles every 30 seconds
Progress to more complex movements
coaching_tips: Focus on staying in front of offensive player

drills.name: Closeout Drill
drills.description: Practice running at a shooter and stopping in proper defensive position!
step_by_step: Place cones around three-point line
Defender starts under basket
Offensive player stands at a cone with ball
Defender sprints toward offensive player
Defender must stop in proper defensive stance
Use proper technique: run and then chop feet
Contest shot with hand up
Rotate positions after each repetition
coaching_tips: Keep hand up to contest shot
Don't let defenders fly by offensive player

drills.name: Box-Out Drill
drills.description: Learn to get good rebounding position by boxing out opponents!
step_by_step: Pair up players - one offense, one defense
Coach shoots ball from various spots
When ball is shot, defensive player finds opponent
Defensive player turns and makes contact
Keep opponent away from basket with wide base
Go get the rebound after securing position
Switch roles after each shot
coaching_tips: Keep wide base and low center of gravity

drills.name: Steal the Bacon
drills.description: Fun defensive reaction drill where players compete to get the loose ball!
step_by_step: Form two lines facing each other 15 feet apart
Number players in each line (1, 2, 3, etc.)
Place ball in middle between lines
Call out a number - those players race for ball
Player who gets ball tries to return to their line
Other player plays defense
Award points for successful returns
Keep score between teams
coaching_tips: Teach safe pursuit of loose balls
Focus on protecting the ball once possessed
Keep game moving with quick rotations

drills.name: Jump Stop
drills.description: Learn to stop quickly and under control - essential for all basketball moves!
step_by_step: Start by jogging slowly down the court
On coach's whistle, jump stop with both feet
Land with feet shoulder-width apart
Bend knees and get into triple threat position
Practice with and without basketball
Increase speed gradually
Add pivoting after the jump stop
coaching_tips: Emphasize landing with both feet at same time
Don't let players travel after stopping

drills.name: Pivoting Practice
drills.description: Master the art of pivoting to protect the ball and create space!
step_by_step: Start in triple threat position with ball
Keep one foot planted (pivot foot)
Step with other foot in different directions
Practice front pivots (step forward)
Practice reverse pivots (step backward)
Keep pivot foot planted at all times
Add ball protection during pivots
coaching_tips: Keep low and balanced during pivots
Practice with both feet as pivot foot

drills.name: Triple Threat Position
drills.description: Learn the most important basketball position - ready to shoot, pass, or dribble!
step_by_step: Hold ball at waist level with both hands
Keep feet shoulder-width apart
Keep knees slightly bent
Ball should be on shooting side
Keep head up and eyes on defense
Practice moving into triple threat from different positions
Practice quick moves from triple threat
coaching_tips: Emphasize being ready for any option
Don't let players hold ball too long

drills.name: Jab Step
drills.description: Use a quick fake step to test the defender and create opportunities!
step_by_step: Start in triple threat position
Take quick, short step with non-pivot foot
Don't fully commit to the step
Return to triple threat position
Read defender's reaction
If defender backs up, take jump shot
If defender stays close, drive past them
coaching_tips: Keep jab step short and controlled

drills.name: V-Cut
drills.description: Learn to get open by cutting toward the ball handler in a V-shape!
step_by_step: Start away from ball handler
Take 2-3 steps toward basket
Plant inside foot and push off
Cut back toward ball handler
Create V-shape with your movement
Call for ball with hands ready
Practice from different positions
coaching_tips: Keep hands ready to catch pass
Time the cut with ball handler

drills.name: Suicides
drills.description: Classic basketball conditioning drill - run to each line and back!
step_by_step: Start at baseline
Sprint to free throw line and back
Immediately sprint to half court and back
Sprint to far free throw line and back
Sprint to opposite baseline and back
Touch each line with your hand
Rest 30 seconds between sets
Complete 3-5 sets
coaching_tips: Adjust number of sets based on age

drills.name: Defensive Slides
drills.description: Build defensive conditioning while practicing proper sliding technique!
step_by_step: Start at sideline in defensive stance
Slide across court maintaining stance
Don't cross feet or stand up
Touch opposite sideline with hand
Slide back to starting position
Complete 5-10 trips across court
Rest between sets
coaching_tips: Keep head up and back straight

drills.name: Dribble Sprints
drills.description: Combine ball handling with conditioning by dribbling at full speed!
step_by_step: Start at baseline with basketball
Dribble full speed to opposite baseline
Use proper dribbling technique while running
Change hands at half court
Walk back while dribbling for recovery
Complete 5-8 full court sprints
Focus on maintaining ball control

drills.name: Agility Ladder
drills.description: Improve foot speed and coordination with quick ladder movements!
step_by_step: Set up agility ladder or use court lines
Practice different foot patterns
Two feet in each box
In-in-out-out pattern
Lateral shuffles through ladder
Single foot hops
Complete 3-5 trips through ladder

drills.name: Basketball Burpees
drills.description: Fun basketball-themed burpees to build total body conditioning!
step_by_step: Start standing with basketball
Place ball on ground and jump feet back to plank
Do one push-up (optional for younger kids)
Jump feet back to squat position
Grab ball and jump up with arms overhead
Land in triple threat position
Complete 10-15 repetitions
coaching_tips: Focus on proper form over speed

drills.name: Sharks and Minnows
drills.description: Exciting dribbling game where minnows try to avoid the sharks!
step_by_step: All players (minnows) start at one baseline with basketballs
Choose 1-2 players to be sharks (no basketball)
Minnows must dribble to opposite baseline
Sharks try to knock balls away from minnows
If ball is knocked away, that player becomes a shark
Continue until only one minnow remains
Winner becomes shark for next round
coaching_tips: Encourage players to keep head up
Have multiple games for large groups

drills.name: Musical Basketballs
drills.description: Basketball version of musical chairs using dribbling skills!
step_by_step: Place basketballs around court (one less than players)
Players walk/jog around basketballs when music plays
When music stops, players grab a basketball and dribble
Player without basketball sits out one round
Remove one basketball and continue
Last player dribbling wins
Add variations like specific dribbling moves
coaching_tips: Keep eliminated players involved as helpers

drills.name: Follow the Leader
drills.description: Practice various basketball movements by following the leader!
step_by_step: Form a line with one player as leader
All players have basketballs
Leader performs various movements while dribbling
Everyone else follows and copies movements
Include crossovers, direction changes, stops
Rotate leadership every 1-2 minutes
Encourage creative movements
coaching_tips: Choose good leaders who demonstrate proper form
Give everyone a chance to lead

drills.name: Basketball Spelling Bee
drills.description: Spell words by making shots - education meets basketball!
step_by_step: Choose words related to basketball or other subjects
Players take turns shooting from designated spots
Each made shot earns one letter of the word
Must spell complete word to win
Miss a shot and next player takes turn
Can use different shot types for different letters
Team version: work together to spell words
coaching_tips: Adjust shooting distances for skill level

drills.name: Hot Potato Passing
drills.description: Fast-paced passing game where you don't want to be holding the 'hot potato'!
step_by_step: Players form circle standing arm's length apart
Pass basketball around circle quickly
When music stops or timer buzzes, player with ball sits down
Continue with remaining players
Circle gets smaller as players are eliminated
Last player standing wins
Add variations like different pass types
